newsitem.title: GERMANY: East German SKET to start liquidation process.
newsitem.headline: East German SKET to start liquidation process.

text.p: SKET GmbH, the former East Germany's biggest heavy machinery group, will on Tuesday apply to begin liquidation proceedings, its supervisory board said late on Monday evening.
Supervisory board head Rudolf Blum said the step had proved unavoidable after workers refused to accept a drastic restructuring plan which would have shed more than two thirds of the workforce.
The board had proposed splitting SKET into five separate operating units and reducing staff to 570 from 1,850.

The board reached its decision to seek liquidation after a long and controversy-ridden meeting on Monday, while hundreds of workers demonstrated against the restructuring plan in the streets of Magdeburg.
German Chancellor Helmut Kohl addressed workers on Monday, urging them not to allow SKET to go under.
